Ich spiele meist als Überlebender und gerade wenn man mit mehreren Leuten während des Spiels kommuniziert kommt das taktische, strategische Gameplay stark zum tragen. Die Vorteile der Charaktere sind extrem vielseitig anpassbar über Fähigkeiten oder Items. Trotzdem ist das Spiel anfängerfreundlich, weil alles ausführlich erklärt ist und man immer mit Spielern in eine "Prüfung geschickt" wird, die dem eigenen Können etwa entsprechen. Nach meinem Geschmack ist die Gewinnchance etwas im Ungleichgewicht zugunsten des Killers, aber auch das schadet dem Spielspaß nicht.

This game allows you to play out the role of the killer in a horror movie and not just one killer but multiple ones from multiple movies, with a few creative liberties taken to make it fit into the game. The idea of getting to play as Michael Meyers, Freddy Krueger, or other included big name horror killers, has quite an alluring draw to it.

After playing for a while with the above idea in mind, that allure may fall off, but you'll find yourself still playing the game for a different reason. Now its time to switch sides to see if you can escape your favorite horror movie mascot instead. Can you survive against Freddy? How about Michael or the others? Can you even survive at all?

Over time, even this allure may fall silent but now the game has done its duty. It has shown you the ins and outs. You have seen the thrill of the hunt. You have seen the thrill of the chase. You have seen the thrill of finally escaping that maniac's clutches. You have seen it all and yet you find yourself in another game repeating your steps like before, almost like clockwork, looking for that next narrow escape or next brutal kill.

The game is easy at times and unforgiving at others. If you do not watch your back, the killer could be walking up on you in a fraction of a moment and you'd be none the wiser. With a hook now in your shoulder, a strange creature begins to manifest before you. What is it? Where did it come from? What is actually going on here? Before you can dwell on these thoughts, your brothers in arms save you, sparing your life momentarily from that strange creature.

But alas, fate is cruel and the killer has found you again. You have nowhere to hide and he pierces your shoulder with another hook. The creature manifests quickly, desperate to not lose its meal a second time. It hastens its advances and manifests fully before your eyes seeking to take you away. It lunges for your body hoping to deal a swift deathblow but it is met with resistance. You are not ready to die and hold off its spear-like tentacle with your bare hands.

Your arms grow tired, and your mind starts to darken as the pain of the hook is still digging into you while you resist this creature. Is this the end for you? Are you too far gone? Will this monstrous being devour you?
When all hope is lost and your strength depleted, you feel relieved. You feel the warm grip of two hands reaching out to you. This is it. This is the end. You stop struggling but to your surprise the creature retreats. Without a second to question his retreat, you are met with immeasurable pain as you are pulled off the hook. You have been saved yet again, but the nightmare is far from over. You are hurt and exhausted. Another encounter with this creature will surely be your last. Can you hide from this killer long enough to escape or will he find you and finally sacrifice your body to the creature he seems so willing to feed. 

Do you have the strength and will to continue on, helping your brothers escape, or will you succumb to despair and hide to save your own skin?

If you escape, will you try you hand at escaping again or will you be the one to hinder their escapes next time? Regardless of your choice, one thing is for certain: the entity is hungry and it needs to be fed. 

Will you be the one to feed it or will you be the food?

this game is easily worth the 20 dollars, the other characters that aren't copy righted can be obtained through grinding for blood shards as well. The game is very fun but the down side is that when playing against a good group of survivors it isn't that well balanced and there are some issues with bugs in the game but for the most part it is very enjoyable and is easily worth the money spent. I have 1500 hours in this game and don't plan to stop any time soon.

Death Is Not an Escape.
Dead by Daylight is a multiplayer (4vs1) horror game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to escape the Killer and avoid being caught, tortured and killed.

Survivors play in third-person and have the advantage of better situational awareness. The Killer plays in first-person and is more focused on their prey.

The Survivors' goal in each encounter is to escape the Killing Ground without getting caught by the Killer - something that sounds easier than it is, especially when the environment changes every time you play.

Key Features
• Survive Together… Or Not - Survivors can either cooperate with the others or be selfish. Your chance of survival will vary depending on whether you work together as a team or if you go at it alone. Will you be able to outwit the Killer and escape their Killing Ground?

• Where Am I? - Each level is procedurally generated, so you’ll never know what to expect. Random spawn points mean you will never feel safe as the world and its danger change every time you play.

• A Feast for Killers - Dead by Daylight draws from all corners of the horror world. As a Killer you can play as anything from a powerful Slasher to terrifying paranormal entities. Familiarize yourself with your Killing Grounds and master each Killer’s unique power to be able to hunt, catch and sacrifice your victims. 
• Deeper and Deeper - Each Killer and Survivor has their own deep progression system and plenty of unlockables that can be customized to fit your own personal strategy. Experience, skills and understanding of the environment are key to being able to hunt or outwit the Killer.

• Real People, Real Fear - The procedural levels and real human reactions to pure horror makes each game session an unexpected scenario. You will never be able to tell how it’s going to turn out. Ambience, music, and chilling environments combine into a terrifying experience. With enough time, you might even discover what’s hiding in the fog.


WARNING: PHOTOSENSITIVITY/EPILEPSY SEIZURES - READ THIS NOTICE BEFORE PLAYING

A very small percentage of people may experience epileptic seizures or blackouts when exposed to certain kinds of flashing lights or light patterns. These persons, or even people who have no history of seizures or epilepsy, may experience epileptic symptoms or seizures while playing video games. If you or any of your relatives has an epileptic condition or has had seizures of any kind, consult your physician before playing any video game.

IMMEDIATELY DISCONTINUE use and consult a physician if you or your child experience any of the following symptoms: dizziness, altered vision, eye or muscle twitching, involuntary movements, loss of awareness, disorientation, or convulsions. Parents should watch for or ask their children about the above symptoms.

You may reduce risk of photosensitive epileptic seizures by taking the following precautions: sit farther from the screen, use a smaller screen, play in a well-lit room, do not play when you are drowsy or fatigued.

Both friendly and toxic community, it really depends on the player themselves, not the game. Try it when it's free and decide if mini heart attacks are worth it, I know it is.

The game is decent and although you keep doing the same stuff every single round, there always is something new. Don't buy it for the sad excuse of a story though XD You can read it in logs..or irnore it, like most do. What I really did not like about it is the DLC policy of the game. To buy a new survivor or Killer you have to pay extra..and it does not add new features to the game, just Characters..which makes the DLC policy even worse then in The Sims. 

The graphics are nice and it has just a few bugs like getting stuck on an invisible stone or tree, which can end up fatal in the chase though 

Everybody says the pairing system sucks, buut, I've seen worse, so works for me...All in all it is a fun game to play with friends, but I can also tell you that playing it alone will get boring quickly
Top

There are bugs EVERYWHERE in this game, and its been out for over 4 years now. Each update adds more bugs and solves a few. But, there is a game somewhere in this bug and it is enjoyable to play with friends. I have 300 hrs on steam and about 500 on PSN and i still find myself coming back to this game, its still somehow enjoyable. 

Overall - 7/10

Solo queue - 5/10

With Friends - 8.5/10

Killer - 8/10
